Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • DefaultCritter
      • Enemy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Critter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BossEnemy, Bunker, HeavyEnemy, LightEnemy

    public class Enemy
extends DefaultCritter
    This class extends DefaultCritter and serves as a model object to create different types of enemies
    Author:
    Bradley Fourie, Daniel Banks, Heinrich Benz
    See Also:
    DefaultCritter

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class DefaultCritter

        radius, xCoord, xVelocity, yCoord, yVelocity

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Enemy(double xCoord, double yCoord, double xVelocity, double yVelocity, double radius, int lives, int shootProbability)
      Class constructor that creates an enemy using the DefaultCritter class as a basis, also adds properties to Enemy by specifying the amount of lives and the probability that the enemy will shoot a missile.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getLives() 
      boolean isShoot()
      Calculates whether or not the enemy is firing a missile, a trigger value is generated in the range from 1 to shootProbability, and then if this trigger value is equal to a specific value, in this case 1 then the enemy fires a missile
      boolean isShooterCollision(Shooter shooter)
      Calculates the Euclidean distance between the enemy and a shooter and checks if the shooter and missile have collided.
      void moveX() 
      void moveY()
      Moves the enemy in the y-direction, if the enemy touches the edge of the canvas then the velocity of the enemy has to be inverted and the enemy's position in the x-direction has to be updated as well.
      boolean onMissileCollision(Missile missile)
      Calculates the Euclidean distance between a missile and the enemy, and checks if the missile and enemy have collided.
      void removeLives(int lives)
      Removes a certain amount of lives from the enemy

      • Methods inherited from class DefaultCritter

        getRadius, getXCoord, getYCoord, setXVelocity, setYVelocity

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(double xCoord,
             double yCoord,
             double xVelocity,
             double yVelocity,
             double radius,
             int lives,
             int shootProbability)
        Class constructor that creates an enemy using the DefaultCritter class as a basis, also adds properties to Enemy by specifying the amount of lives and the probability that the enemy will shoot a missile.
        Parameters:
        xCoord - the x-coordinate of the enemy
        yCoord - the y-coordinate of the enemy
        xVelocity - the x-velocity of the enemy
        yVelocity - the y-velocity of the enemy
        radius - the radius or "size" of the enemy
        lives - the amount of lives the enemy has before it gets destroyed or removed from the game
        shootProbability - the probability that the enemy will shoot a missile
        See Also:
        DefaultCritter

    • Method Detail

      • onMissileCollision

        public boolean onMissileCollision(Missile missile)
        Calculates the Euclidean distance between a missile and the enemy, and checks if the missile and enemy have collided.
        Parameters:
        missile - the missile on the canvas that is being checked for if it has collided with the enemy
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if the enemy has collided with the missile else false

      • isShooterCollision

        public boolean isShooterCollision(Shooter shooter)
        Calculates the Euclidean distance between the enemy and a shooter and checks if the shooter and missile have collided.
        Parameters:
        shooter - the shooter on the canvas that is being used to check for a collision
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if the enemy has collided with a shooter else false

      • removeLives

        public void removeLives(int lives)
        Removes a certain amount of lives from the enemy
        Parameters:
        lives - the amount of lives to be removed from the enemy

      • isShoot

        public boolean isShoot()
        Calculates whether or not the enemy is firing a missile, a trigger value is generated in the range from 1 to shootProbability, and then if this trigger value is equal to a specific value, in this case 1 then the enemy fires a missile
        Returns:
        a boolean value corresponding to whether or not the enemy is firing a missile

      • moveY

        public void moveY()
        Moves the enemy in the y-direction, if the enemy touches the edge of the canvas then the velocity of the enemy has to be inverted and the enemy's position in the x-direction has to be updated as well.

      • moveX

        public void moveX()

      • getLives

        public int getLives()
